intro: Tetraplasandra lydgatei var. leptorachis, commonly known as the slender-leafed tetraplasandra, is a rare and endangered plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, strap-like leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by dark purple berries, which are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to habitat loss, conservation efforts are crucial for its survival.
